Web Personal Assistant 1 documentation

GPT functionality¶

  • You can chat with ChatGPT, which has set prompts for teaching you English.

GPT’s views¶

gpt.views.chat(request, messages=[])¶

The chat function is the main function of this file. It takes in a request object and an optional list of messages, and returns a JsonResponse containing the response to be sent back to the user. The chat function first checks if it has received a POST request or not; if it has, then it will add any new message from the user into its list of messages and then call conversation() with that updated list as an argument. Then, after receiving both role and content from conversation(), chat() adds those two values into its own message list before returning them as part of a JsonResponse.

Parameters:

  • request – Get the request from the client

  • messages – Store the messages that have been sent

Returns:

The response of the chatbot

gpt.views.tasks(request)¶

The tasks function is a view that renders the tasks.html template.

Parameters:

request – Pass the request object to the view

Returns:

The render template ‘gpt/html.tasks’

gpt.views.text_correction(request)¶

The text_correction function is a view that takes in a POST request from the text_correction.html page, which contains the user’s inputted message. The function then passes this message to check_sentence() and returns the corrected sentence as well as the original sentence back to text_correction.html.

Parameters:

request – Get the data from the user

Returns:

A json response with the original message and the corrected message

GPT’s services.checking_sentences¶

gpt.services.checking_sentences.check_sentence(prompt)¶

The check_sentence function takes a string as an argument and returns the same string with any grammatical errors corrected.

Parameters:

prompt – Pass in the sentence to be corrected

Returns:

The corrected sentence

gpt.services.conversation.conversation(messages)¶

The conversation function takes in a list of messages and returns the role (speaker) and content (message) of the response. The model used is gpt-3.5-turbo, which is the largest model available on OpenAI’s API.

Parameters:

messages – Pass in the messages that have been sent so far

Returns:

A tuple of (role, message)

GPT’s urls¶

This module contains all the urls for the gpt app.
